original: Brising, Lars Harald, civilingenjör, Linköping, f. 18/5/15 i Sthlm av fil. dr Harald B. o. Louise Welhaven. G. 42 m. Maja-Brita Frödell. Barn: Louise f. 44, Dag 47. — Stud :ex. i Sthlm 33, civ :-ing:ex v. KTH (M) 38. Kontr :ing. v. filygförvaltn. 38, konstr. v. A-B Götaverken 39, anst. v. V^altion Lentoko-netehdas i Finl. 40, provn:ing. v. Sv. Aeroplan A-B 40-41, flyging. av tredje gr. v. flygv. 41-43, konstr :chef v. Sv. Aeroplan A-B i Linköp. sed. 43. Led. av Sv. tekn:fören.
translated: Brising, Lars Harald, civil engineer, from Linköping, born on May 18, 1915 in Stockholm to PhD Harald B. and Louise Welhaven. Married in 1942 to Maja-Brita Frödell. Children: Louise born in 1944, Dag born in 1947. Lars passed his student exam in Stockholm in 1933 and graduated with a degree in civil engineering from KTH (M) in 1938. He worked as a contract engineer for filygförvaltn in 1938 and as a designer for A-B Götaverken in 1939. In 1940, he was employed at the Valtion Lentokonetehdas in Finland as a tester. From 1940-1941, he served as a test pilot for the Swedish Aeroplane Company AB and later as a flying officer for the third group of the Air Force from 1941-1943. From 1943, he served as the chief designer at the Swedish Aeroplane Company AB in Linköping. Lars was a member of the Swedish Technical Association.
